captions.text:
>>THE BEST PART ABOUT THIS STEW IS,
YOU CAN'T GO WRONG WITH THE ADD-INS.

I PUT IN MUSHROOMS, ASPARAGUS,
EVEN SAUSAGE.

I CAN LITERALLY PUT ANYTHING INTO THIS STEW
AND I'LL STILL LOVE IT
AND YOU WILL TOO.
ACTUALLY IT'S NOT THAT--

>>BALANCE RESTORED!
>>I CAN'T BELIEVE SHE BROKE UP WITH ME.

I AM LITERALLY CRUSHED MAL.
I JUST WISH I WAS HAVING A BETTER DAY.

>>BALANCE RESTORED.
>>IT'S OFFICIAL EVERYONE.

THE WORD LITERALLY NOW ALSO MEANS "NOT LITERALLY"
THAT IS TO SAY, METAPHORICALLY.

>>GOOD SHOW EVERYBODY!
CONGRATULATIONS!
[THUNDERCLAP]

>>WHAT HAVE YOU DONE?
>>CAPTAIN, WE SIMPLY DEFINED THE WORD WITH--

[SLAP] >>CAPTAIN, IT>S TOO LATE.
THERE'S LITERALLY NOTHING YOU CAN DO.

>>OH NO?
WHEN THE WORLD REALIZES IT NOW HAS A WORD

THAT MEANS
WHAT IT MEANS BUT LITERALLY DOESN'T MEAN WHAT

IT MEANS,
THINGS WILL CHANGE.

WHEN THE PEOPLE NO LONGER
BOW TO THE YOKE OF OXFORD,

THINGS WILL CHANGE.
AND WHEN ROB LOWE'S CHARACTER FINALLY LEAVES

PARKS AND REC,
THINGS WILL CHANGE.

AND I WILL BE THERE TO LEAD THEM,
TIRELESSLY, DAY AND NIGHT UNTIL THIS

WRONG HAS BEEN RIGHTED.
OR I CAN LITERALLY SET YOUR CARS ON FIRE.
>>DO YOU MEAN LITERALLY OR LITERALLY?
HE MEANT LITERALLY. [SIGHS OF RELIEF]
